Twitter Title: Single Disc Brake For Bike, Motorcycle & Scooty Price List 2023 in India
Content( Top): The single Disc Brake system is among the most popular and reliable braking systems in the market. Motorcycle disc brake price in India remains justified for the power it delivers to bring the vehicle to a complete halt. Single disc brake motorcycles are well known for providing greater speed modulation, outstanding stopping power, and all-weather performance. Presently, in India, a single disc brake set for motorcycles is seen in 110cc to 165 cc bikes. The popular models in India that have single-disc brakes are Honda Shine, Bajaj Pulsar 125 and Hero Glamour.
H2: Single Disc Brake Bikes in India
Content(Body):
Find Single Disc Brake Bikes 
The single disc braking system, which was first manufactured exclusively for mountain bikes, has now become the new standard. Nowadays, the majority of vehicles have disc brakes. They are attached to the vehicle's front or back side. A disc brake employs a calliper equipped with brake pads to grasp a rotating disc or rotor in order to stop a wheel (and your bike). 

The effectiveness of disc brakes in motorcycles is significantly influenced by the size of the disc/rotor. 240-300 mm front discs are the most common size on bikes in India. This Buell XB12SX Lightning City X, which used 375 mm front disc brakes, is one example of a big rotor. 

The disc, calliper, and brake pads make up the disc brake kit for motorcycles. The disc or rotor is mounted on the outside of the wheel and has brake pads on either side in the basic design of a bicycle or scooter's disc brake system. The viscous fluid that connects the entire system is referred to as brake oil, and it is connected via a thick fluid line. The oil reservoir, which is linked to the pump and the brake lever, is where the brake oil is obtained. 

Bikes equipped with single-disc brakes are popularly known as single-disc variants. However, bikes manufactured with disc and drum brakes on the front and rear wheels are known as single-disc motorcycles. Single Disc brake in motorcycles, as the name suggests, single-disc braking is used on one wheel of a bike. 

How disc brake works in motorcycles- 

The disc brake motorcycle system effectively stops the vehicle by employing hydraulic pressure by converting the speed of the bike into heat. Brake pads are attached to the callipers that are in contact with the discs. When the brake pedal is pressed, the braking fluid is forced to move, which puts hydraulic pressure on the brake pads. The pressure causes the brake pads to squeeze the braking disc. Because of the friction created between the disc and the pad, your bike slows down. 

Single disc brakes are typically made of cast iron. High-performance vehicles use rotors made of composite materials like vehicles on fibre or ceramic. Due to the directional vanes they contain, some of the rotors can only be mounted on one side of the vehicle. 

Why do you need to opt for bikes with Single Disc Brakes? 

Powerful Gripping Ability 

The stopping and gripping power of disc brakes are superior to that of traditional drum brakes. They can increase friction in the disc and reduce wheel movement. 

More Effective in Adverse Weather 

Disc brakes are effective in adverse weather. If wet, they may dry quickly and easily. Even during the rainy season, brakes maintain their gripping force. 

Simple to Clean 

Drum brakes require more maintenance than disc brakes. The mechanic has to open the drum brake fully. On the other hand, it is simple to clean the disc. 

No Heating Up 

They require little hand pressing and are simple to control. Drivers must apply intense pressure to drum brakes in order to stop their motorcycles. Due to being open, disc brakes do not heat up. In the event that they heat up, they cool down within a few seconds. 

Different from other brakes, no rim damage 

The absence of wheel damage is another benefit of disc brakes. For instance, rim brakes create a rough surface when applied repeatedly. No such problem will be faced with the first disc. 

Popular Models in India that are equipped with Single Disc Braking system: 

Honda Shine 
Bajaj Pulsar 125 
Hero Glamour 
Hero Super Splendor 
TVS Apache RTR 160" Brand
FAQ's:
Q. What Are India’s 3 Most Popular Single Disc Bikes That Are Sold The Most? 

A. Honda Shine, Bajaj Pulsar 125 and Hero Glamour are one of India’s highest-selling bikes equipped with single disc braking systems. 

Q. What Is The Use Of Disc Brakes In Motorcycles? 

A. Disc brake motorcycles use calipers to press pads against the disc to create friction. This action slows the rotation of the shaft, thus, reducing rotational speed of the vehicle. 

Q. Is A Single Disc Bike Good? 

A. Yes, it is much more reliable than the traditional drum brakes and has a much stronger stopping power. They are also known to be much more long lasting and justified for the price. 

Q. What Is The Best Type Of Disc Brake? 

A. Carbon ceramic discs are much more heat resistant, and are less likely to deform or warp due to heavy use, meaning they'll usually last longer. As a bonus, they're typically much lighter than their iron counterparts.

FAQ's:
Q. What Is An EMI? 

A. EMI is referred to as Equated Monthly Installments. When someone takes a loan, he gets off the loan amount through finance companies, and for others, he pays down payments. For repaying, the Bank allows you to pay the considerable loan amount in monthly installments, including interest. 

Q. What Is The Down Payment Amount? 

A. Down Payment is the difference between the on-road price and the amount you take on the loan. If the on-road price is Rs. 1,25,000 and you are taking Rs. 1,00,000 on finance, then Rs. 25,000 will be the down payment. 

Q. What Will Be The Interest Rates For The Two-Wheeler Loan? 

A. The interest rate of your two-wheeler loan depends on the amount remaining after the down payment. And also, it depends on the EMI tenure you have chosen. 

Q. What Are The Steps To Calculate EMI From BikeJunction? 

A. You can calculate EMI with BikeJunction in 3 easy steps: 
Visit BikeJunction official website. 
Click on the EMI Calculator tab on the main menu bar. 
Select the Brand, Model and Variant of your 2-wheeler and finally click on to calculate EMI. 
You will then get a comprehensive and accurate EMI calculation based on the down payment and bank interest rate you choose. 

Q. What Are The Charges If The Bike Loan EMI Is Missed? 

A. The charges of missed EMI are decided by the finance company you choose. You need to pay the mandatory amount of late fee. 

Q. What Will Be The Tenure Of My Bike Loan? 

A. Bike Loan tenure depends upon the EMI duration you are taking. For example, you can avail of a 12-monthly EMI option in which you need to pay significant amounts of EMIs, but the interest rate will be lower. On the other hand, you can go for an EMI option for 84 months, in which you have to pay a low amount of EMIs at a high-interest rate. 

Q. What Needs To Be Done After Paying The Last EMI Of The Two-Wheeler Loan? 

A. Many people who take loans think that the job is done after the last EMI, but you need to complete some tasks after the repayment of your two-wheeler loans which are written below: 
Get your close loan receipt and last EMI receipt. 
Get the NOC (No Objection Certificate) or the NDC (No Due Certificate) from the Bank. 
Get the repayment certificate from the Bank. 

Q. What Are The Documents Required For The Two Wheeler Loan? 

A. To start the loan application process, you need to submit a copy of all the KYC documents to the finance company. The KYC includes your current address, income proof, Aadhar Card, PAN Card, and Bank statement.

All About Best Electric-Scooters in India

If you are in the market for the best e scooter in India, you should know that electric scooters offer many advantages over petrol-powered scooters. Electric scooty are eco-friendly, as they have zero emissions and run on battery. They also have lower running costs, as they do not require frequent refuelling or maintenance. 

Moreover, electric scooters are easy to charge at home or at public charging stations. Thanks to the government’s incentives and policies, electric scooty is becoming more popular and easy to access in India every year. Some of the best e scooter in India include Ather 450X Gen 3, Ola S1 Pro, TVS iQube, Bajaj Chetak and Vida V1. Why Upgrade to Electric Scooters? 
Best EV scooters have many benefits over conventional scooters, such as zero emission, low maintenance, easy charging and other smart features. 

Electric scooters do not produce any harmful gases or pollutants that contribute to air pollution and global warming. They also reduce noise pollution as they are much quieter than petrol or diesel scooters. Electric scooters do not require frequent servicing or oil changes as they have fewer moving parts and no combustion engine. They also have lower wear and tear as they do not have gears or clutches. 

Electric scooters can be charged easily at home or office using a standard wall socket or a dedicated charging station. Some models also have removable batteries that can be swapped for fully charged ones. 

The best scooter in India 2023 comes with various smart features that enhance the riding experience and safety. For example, some models have GPS navigation, remote diagnostics, geo-fencing, an anti-theft system and voice control. Some models also have regenerative braking systems that help conserve energy by converting kinetic energy into electrical energy during braking. 

How to Choose the Right or Best Electric Scooter? 
You can look for several factors while choosing the best e scooter in India, such as performance, price, design etc. The performance of an electric scooter depends on its battery power, top speed and range per charge. 

You should choose the best electric scooter in India that can suit your specific needs and budget. For example, if you want to travel long distances at high speeds, you should opt for a high-performance model with a powerful motor and a large battery capacity. However, if you want to use it for short trips within the city at moderate speeds, you can go for moderately performing models with relatively smaller motor and battery capacity. 

If you wish to travel in style, you can choose the best electric scooter in India based on ergonomic design and colour preferences. The design of an electric scooter includes its shape, size and colour. So, you should choose an electric scooter that appeals to your taste and personality. You should also consider the comfort and safety aspects of an electric scooter’s design, such as its seat height, handlebar position and suspension system. 

Electric scooters are a smart and eco-friendly choice for anyone who wants to enjoy a convenient, economical and environmentally friendly mode of transportation. They offer many advantages over conventional petrol or diesel scooters such, as zero emissions, low maintenance, easy charging and smart features. 

You should carefully consider your needs, preferences and budget before buying an electric scooter.

A. Ola s1 pro claims to have a range of 181 km in single charge along with an average speed of 60 km/h. 

Q. How Do I Charge My Electric Scooter? 

A. You can charge your electric scooter by plugging it into any standard wall socket using the charger provided by the manufacturer or you can use a charging station. 

Q. How Long Does It Take To Charge My Electric Scooter? 

A. The charging time depends on the battery capacity and charger output of your electric scooter model. Generally speaking, it can take anywhere from one hour to six hours. 

Q. How Far Can I Go On One Charge? 

A. Electric scooters can operate from 50 km to 200 km on a single charge on an average. However, the range of electric scooters depends upon several factors such as speed, battery age, and more. 

Q. Do I Need A Licence Or Registration To Ride An Electric Scooter? 

A. The rules vary depending on your state or city laws. Some places may require you to have a valid driving licence or registration while others may not. Please check with your local authorities before riding an electric scooter.

All About Latest Electric-Bikes in India 
India is on its way to a greener future; with that, the auto industry is transitioning from fuel-based vehicles to battery-powered ones. People are beginning to feel more environmentally cautious, increasing the demand for electric bikes and scooters like never before. 

And to tap into this growing demand, numerous industry leaders are coming out with the latest electric bike in India. In addition, multiple startups have also emerged that are coming out with feature-rich EV bikes in the Indian market. And, unlike a few years ago, today, customers have a plethora of options to choose from. Today, customers can explore the widest range of the latest E bikes in terms of the price range, driving range, charging time, power outputs and more. So everyone can find the latest electric bike model that suits their lifestyle and budget. 

Benefits of Switching to Latest Electric Bike in India: 
Switching your traditional fuel-based bike with an electric bike latest model will help you eliminate your daily fuel expenses. But more importantly, it will help you reduce your carbon footprint. 

With electric bikes, you won't have to stress about rising fuel costs that don't appear to be going down anytime soon. 
The maintenance of modern electric motorcycles is significantly simpler and less expensive than that of older bikes powered by fuel. 
The maintenance of modern electric motorcycles is significantly simpler and less expensive than that of older bikes powered by fuel. You may easily reduce your daily fuel costs and operating costs with electric bikes. 
Electric bikes can cover long distances on a single charge, so users don’t have to worry about refuelling anymore. 
The cost of new electric motorcycles is reasonable, compared to traditional bikes powered by petrol.
